code: /* * Copyright (c) 2014-2017 BSI Business Systems Integration AG. * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0 * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html * * Contributors: * BSI Business Systems Integration AG - initial API and implementation */ import { FocusContext } from '../index'; /** * Rule describing how to resolve a focusable element. * * @see FocusManager.js */ var FocusRule = { /** * Indicates to focus the first focusable element. */ AUTO: 'auto', /** * Indicates to not focus any element. */ NONE: 'none', /** * If prepare is used when installing a focus context, the context won't be ready until explicitly told. During that time, focus context listeners are not attached yet and focus requests are not allowed to be executed. * But: the element of the focused request will be stored as usual in lastValidFocusedElement. So as soon as the context is ready, a call to restoreFocus would focus that element. * * This is useful to disable focus requests during a preparation phase without losing the element which should be focused. * * Important: {@link FocusContext#ready()} must be called manually as soon as the focus context is ready. */ PREPARE: 'prepare' }; export default FocusRule;

sourcesContent: /* * Copyright (c) 2014-2017 BSI Business Systems Integration AG. * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0 * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html * * Contributors: * BSI Business Systems Integration AG - initial API and implementation */ import {FocusContext} from '../index'; /** * Rule describing how to resolve a focusable element. * * @see FocusManager.js */ const FocusRule = { /** * Indicates to focus the first focusable element. */ AUTO: 'auto', /** * Indicates to not focus any element. */ NONE: 'none', /** * If prepare is used when installing a focus context, the context won't be ready until explicitly told. During that time, focus context listeners are not attached yet and focus requests are not allowed to be executed. * But: the element of the focused request will be stored as usual in lastValidFocusedElement. So as soon as the context is ready, a call to restoreFocus would focus that element. * * This is useful to disable focus requests during a preparation phase without losing the element which should be focused. * * Important: {@link FocusContext#ready()} must be called manually as soon as the focus context is ready. */ PREPARE: 'prepare' }; export default FocusRule;
